text: testin trace schemes help tell us where
coronavirus is and how it's spreading
this is a race
the sooner infectious people are found
the less the virus spreads first test
the people who are isolating at home
with coded 19:00 symptoms if someone
tests positive then it goes to stage 2
trace in the UK contact tracers ask the
infected person about their close
contacts people they've recently been
less than 2 metres from for more than 15
minutes of course if you get closer to
someone for instance kiss them or have a
face-to-face conversation with them from
less than a meter you'll be contacted no
matter how long the time period if
people are following social distancing
rules there shouldn't be a long list
it could include friends family
housemates co-workers these people will
also be told to stay at home for 14 days
whether they feel ill or not they should
only get tested if they develop symptoms
themselves that's what happens with
people you know but what about those who
don't some countries use a contact
tracing app to track people's movements
and find these strangers to alert those
who need to self isolate if you're self
isolating in the UK you're entitled to
statutory sick pay and you should
isolate every time you're told to even
if you've had Kovac 19:00 before so you
test and trace people to track down the
virus and help countries move out of
lockdown
